content: friday the fish crochet pattern by thalia evans you ll need pattern uses us terms - 3 5mm crochet hook slip_stitch = slip_stitch - dk yarn in colour s of your choice this fish is single_crochet = single_crochet based on a carp/goldfish but can be made in any half_double_crochet = half_double_crochet colour double_crochet = double_crochet - toy stuffing a good way to use up scraps increase = increase 2 single_crochet in same stitch of yarn decrease = decrease sc2 together - needle scissors pins stitch markers flo = work in front loop only - for the eyes black or contrasting blo = work in back loop only and white embroidery thread or alternatively shift stitch= at the end of the current round move 4-5mm safety eyes or round beads stitch marker forward if right handed or back if left handed one stitch count the stitch after the marker as stitch 1 of the new round approx finished size 4 inches long the example fish were crocheted right handed if you hold the hook in your left hand you will have to mirror the photos the pattern includes two options for completing this project option 1 option 2 easy- sew-together body & tail are made in one hard- seamless the body fins and tail are piece fins are made separately and sewn on at the crocheted in place using one continuous strand of end less fiddly but involves a lot of sewing and yarn involves some fiddly stitches but no sewing making sure fins are placed correctly use this option if you don t like sewing on lots of use this option if you want to make contrasting small pieces or don t want to worry about getting the colour fins easily want to customise the position of fins in the right places works well with ombre or self the fins or don t mind sewing striping yarn contents body notes- page 2 option 1 sew together - page 2 option 2 seamless - page 4 tail- page 8 fins- page 10 mouth & eyes- page 12 1 body the body is worked in continuous spiral rounds using increases and decreases for shaping do not join rounds make sure the right side of the work is facing out to create the gill details and fins in option 2 you ll need to work in the front loops only back loops only or middle loops only as indicated in the pattern for all other scs work in both loops the tail is worked in row after stuffing and closing the body important use a stitch marker to keep track of the start of the round stitch markers in the stitch before and after each gill/fin may also be helpful if you have trouble finding the back loops a note on shift stitches the start of the round will always shift gradually to the right or left if you crochet left handed when working in continuous rounds to keep the body symmetrical and
